abstract: Big lenders had hoped to piggyback on Wells Fargo’s small Wall Street presence to resist proposals to curb pay and ban merchant banking.
snippet: Big lenders had hoped to piggyback on Wells Fargo’s small Wall Street presence to resist proposals to curb pay and ban merchant banking.
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo has deprived banks of a Washington standard-bearer. Big lenders hoped to piggyback on their rival’s lack of Wall Street taint to resist proposals to curb pay and ban merchant banking. But the fake-accounts scandal weakens Wells Fargo’s ability to lead the charge.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Scandal Blunts a Weapon in Banks’ Regulatory Fight
